headline: Donostia Throughout History
text:
The best way of adapting to a new country and a new culture is learning about it's most important events. In this sample timeline we are going to cover some of the most important events of Donostia's history and explain their relevance to the city's culture. Some of the events have a big relevance, because they have turned out in important cultural festivities, and some others are important to understand the origins of Donostia

.

headline: Medieval and Early Historry
text: To know about the beginings of Donostia, we have to turn back to 12th Century, the time where the city was founded

headline: Foundation of the City
text: San Sebastián was officially founded by King Sancho VI of Navarre. It was granted a fuero (municipal charter) to attract settlers and develop trade.

headline: Incorporation into Castile
text: The city, along with the province of Gipuzkoa, was annexed by the Kingdom of Castile, shifting its allegiance from Navarre.

headline: First royal visit in San Sebastián
text: Francisco de Paula, brother of the King Fernando VII and his wife Luisa Carlotta, sister of the Queen Maria Cristina.

headline: Demolition of the City Walls
text: This event marked the beginning of modern San Sebastián and the urban expansion

headline: Inauguration of Kursaal and Victoria Eugenia Theatre
text: Cultural development flourished, and San Sebastián became a center of Belle Époque architecture and leisure.

headline: Spanish Civil War
text: San Sebastián initially fell under Republican control, but was soon taken by Francoist troops. It started years of political repression.

headline: Inauguration of San Sebastián International Film Festival
Jazzaldia Inauguration
text: It is known for being one of the most important Jazz festivals in Europe, where artists from the whole world come to play

headline: Basque Nationalism and ETA activity
text: During this decade, the city experienced the tensions of Basque separatism and acts of violence tied to ETA during Spain's transition to democracy.

headline: Launch of San Sebastián International Film Festival
text: Although it was founded in 1953, the festival gained global recognition by the 1990s, establishing the city as cultural hub.

headline: New Kursaal Congress Center Opens
text: Designed by architect Rafael Moneo, the new Kursaal symbolizes the cultural renaissance of San Sebastián

headline: European Capital of Culture
text: San Sebastián was named the European Capital of Culture, recognizing its strong identity, cultural diversity, and civic initiatives.
